text: Frank Horvat (28 April 1928 – 21 October 2020) was an Croatian-French photographer. He was best known for his fashion photography, published between the mid 1950s and the late 1980s. Horvat's photographic opus includes photojournalism, portraiture, landscape, nature, and sculpture.Contemporary photographers, dir. Martin Marix Evans, article "Horvat Frank", St James Press, Detroit, 1995, pp 508–511. In 1988, he produced a book of interviews with fellow photographers such as Don McCullin, Robert Doisneau, Sarah Moon, Helmut Newton, and Marc Riboud. Horvat died in October 2020, at the age of 92. ==Bibliography== * 1957 : La capture des éléphants sauvages, Editions Louvois, Paris, * 1962 : J'aime la télévision, Editions Rencontre, Lausanne, Switzerland (text by Max Egli), * 1962 : J'aime le strip-tease, Editions Rencontre, Lausanne, Switzerland (text by Patrik Lindermohr), * 1979 : The Tree, Aurum Press, London and Little, Brown, New York (text by John Fowles), * 1990 : Entre vues, Éditions Nathan, Paris, * 1991 : Degas sculptures, Imprimerie nationale, Paris, * 1992 : Yao le chat botté, Éditions Gautier- Languereau, Paris, * 1994 : Arbres, Imprimerie nationale, Paris, * 1994 : Le Bestiaire d’Horvat, CNP et Actes Sud, * 1996 : Paris-Londres, London-Paris, Éditions de la Ville de Paris, * 1996 : De la Mode et des Jardins, Éditions de l’Imprimerie Nationale, Paris, * 1998 : 51 Photographs in Black and White, Dewi Lewis, Manchester, ==References== Category:2020 deaths Category:1928 births Category:Croatian people Category:French photographers
